item.title: You Won't Believe What Happened When Chicken Came Home to Roost!
item.description: Introduction A Background Information The phrase “when the chicken comes home to roost” is a popular idiom that is often used to refer to the consequences of one’s actions It is believed to have originated in the early 19th century and has been used by a variety of authors, including Mark Twain and William Faulkner The phrase is used to illustrate the idea that the consequences of one’s actions will eventually come back to haunt them
